title: Chitrakoot: Detained youth found dead, SHO and juniors booked for murder
selftext: Family and friends allege torture in custody; police say the 22-year-old fled from thana, jumped in front of a train
comments: That's my issue with making a police state. You can't and shouldn't give police this much power as it may have long term consequences and it becomes much harder to keep the police in check. From this to bulldozer justice, I don't like this at all. I don't like the idea of giving unbridled power to the state or any one person.

We desperately need a sub indianpolicebrutality...maybe the mods of this sub could make one. I'm from a rural area and I cannot stress enough how the method of custodial torture and apparent delayed arrest is used by police on weaker sections of society.

Do the police also say he tied and blindfolded himself too? And knocked his teeth in himself too? 

/s
This is why we need body cams for the police.
Fuck... Mere hometown ki news idhar¬†
